tweet: Watch now @RepHarley' s opening statement from today's Environment Subcommittee hearing on the severe health impacts of #climatechange! pic.twitter.com/4RRjW7DXTz

"This is not a hypothetical conversation. This is not a false narrative. #Climatechange has direct and indirect effects on human health, and these health effects are already being felt across the United States. These effects are real now and REQUIRE action. " - @RepHarley
"Instead of acting in the public interest to address these serious health effects, the #TrumpAdmin's proposed rollbacks seek to weaken and gut protections for clean air and clean water."
"Other vulnerable populations, such as children, seniors, and women, are also already facing and will continue to face the negative brunt of continued inaction."
"Today we will concentrate on the current impacts that #globalwarming is already having on the health of everyday Americans."

"This hearing is the second in the series of hearings on #climatechange that the Committee on Oversight and Reform‚Äôs Subcommittee on Environment plans to hold during the 116th Congress. " -Chairman @RepHarley

WATCH NOW Chairman @RepCummings opening statement from our hearing on the financial condition of the #USPS! pic.twitter.com/oJ9nSb9oag

"Our nation can and must honor the commitments we have made to the men and women who dedicate their lives to delivering our mail day in and day out in every conceivable condition." - Chairman @RepCummings
"We must not place the burden of reforming the Postal Service on the backs of postal workers. Their wages and benefits are modest."

"If major changes are not made soon, there will come a time when the Postal Service will run out of cash, and its ability to provide the services Americans rely on will be in jeopardy. Congress has a responsibility to ensure that day never comes."
"For example, in fiscal year 2018, the Postal Service had less than two months' worth of cash on hand on an average day."

"Today, one of the most pressing concerns for the Postal Service is its dwindling  http://liquidity.As¬† its expenses continue to grow more quickly than its revenues, the Postal Service faces challenges with having enough cash to conduct its operations."

"It delivers mail and packages to nearly 159 million locations, no matter how remote. And it binds together every comer of our nation.Unfortunately, the Postal Service's financial condition has been deteriorating over the past decade."

"We are holding a very important hearing on the future of the #UnitedStatesPostalService. The Postal Service is one of our nation's most essential and recognizable institutions. It provides universal service to every single address in the United States." -Chairman @RepCummings

TUNE IN NOW as we are holding a hearing to review the current financial condition of the Postal Service, as well as the urgent need for reform legislation!

"But the #TrumpAdministration‚Äôs stonewalling has left the Committee no choice but to obtain this information by compulsory process." - Chairman @RepCummings
"We have bent over backwards to try to work with the #TrumpAdministration. We identified priority documents, we extended deadlines, and we even offered to review certain documents in camera."

"The Supreme Court has rejected this claim repeatedly. It is not the law, and it would lead to absurd results. If this were the policy, we would have to shut down our investigations every time a private party decided to sue a federal agency"
"Let me be clear: The Administration may not withhold information from Congress because of separate litigation.  That is not a valid legal argument."
"NONE of these requests is new. They are all items we asked for repeatedly, but the #TrumpAdministration refused to produce."

"The Committee is trying to determine the real reason #SecretaryRoss added the citizenship question, and the documents and testimony covered by these subpoenas are critical to answering that question".

" #SecretaryRoss testified repeatedly that he added the citizenship question ‚Äúsolely‚Äù at the request of #DOJ, but the record shows that this was a pretext. In fact, #SecretaryRoss began a secret campaign to orchestrate the addition of the citizenship question months before."

"As we all know, last year #WilburRoss, the Secretary of Commerce, decided to add a citizenship question to the census, even though his own #CensusBureau warned that the question ‚Äúharms the quality of the census count.‚Äù
"(1) for a deposition of John Gore, a senior official at the #DOJ; (2) for documents withheld by #DOJ; and (3) for documents withheld by the #DepartmentofCommerce."
"This resolution relates to our investigation of the #TrumpAdministration‚Äôs decision to add a citizenship question to the census. It authorizes me to issue three subpoenas"- Chairman @RepCummings
"Then just offer us general information about their policies‚Äînot when there are such serious allegations of a risk to national security‚Äù ‚Äì Chairman @RepCummings.
‚ÄúI strongly urge my colleagues to vote in support of this subpoena.  The #WhiteHouse needs to understand that they cannot stonewall and stall this Committee for months."
‚ÄúMs. Newbold came forward out of concern for our country and our national security. And she called on us to act.  To do our jobs.  To conduct credible, independent oversight.‚Äù
‚ÄúI just want to emphasize that point.  She came forward because the system at the #WhiteHouse is so dysfunctional that she believes #Congress needs to intervene.‚Äù
"In fact, she implored the Committee to act now, warning that ‚Äúthis is my last hope to really bring the integrity back into our office.‚Äù
"As a result, she warned that security clearance applications for #WhiteHouse officials ‚Äúwere not always adjudicated in the best interest of national security.‚Äù
‚ÄúShe has informed the us  that during the #TrumpAdministration, she and other career officials adjudicated denials of dozens of applications for security clearances that were later overturned."

‚ÄúAs she said during her interview with Committee staff [ ‚Äú I would not be doing a service to myself, my country, or my children if I sat back knowing that the issues that we have could impact national security‚Äù]

‚ÄúHer name is Tricia Newbold, and she came forward at great personal risk to warn Congress‚Äîand the nation‚Äîabout the grave security risks she has been witnessing first-hand over the past two years.‚Äú
‚ÄúYesterday, I sent a memo to all Committee Members providing information from a detailed, on-the-record interview with a #whistleblower who currently works in the #WhiteHouse.‚Äú
